high_relevance.theory_name: Open Source Project Governance and Meritocracy
high_relevance.description: Explains how OSS projects formalize roles, governance, and meritocratic advancement from peripheral contributor to core maintainer.
high_relevance.relevance_to_rqs: Directly addresses how contributors move from novice periphery to core roles, including the criteria and governance mechanisms that enable or block progression, now affected by AI-mediated contributions.
high_relevance.relevance_to_model: Maps to Promotion Rate, Review Rate, PR Feedback, Culture Erosion/Trust Building, Maintainer time, and Community Health; governance rules affect gatekeeping, review throughput, and promotion thresholds.
high_relevance.phd_contribution: Model how AI-inflated contribution volume changes gatekeeping thresholds and role legitimation, identifying governance adaptations that preserve fairness and throughput.
model_additions: Gatekeeping Intensity (Auxiliary → Review Rate, Rejection Rate)
AI-Assisted Contribution Share (Auxiliary) → New Pr rate, Rejection Rate

high_relevance.description: An organization’s ability to recognize, assimilate, and apply new knowledge depends on prior related knowledge and learning routines.
high_relevance.relevance_to_rqs: Explains how projects internalize AI-related practices and how contributors assimilate AI-generated code/feedback to advance toward core roles.
high_relevance.relevance_to_model: Links Projects's Explicit Knowledge, Project's Implicit Knowledge, Knowledge Conversion Rate, and Review Rate to effective utilization of AI-derived knowledge and faster skill up/promotion.
high_relevance.phd_contribution: Quantify how project- and individual-level absorptive capacity moderates the effect of AI tools on progression speed and quality outcomes.
model_additions: Individual Absorptive Capacity (Stock for contributor cohorts)
Assimilation Friction (Auxiliary) → Review Rate, Rejection Rate

high_relevance.theory_name: Social Capital: Closure and Structural Holes
high_relevance.description: Social ties enable access to information, trust, and opportunities; bridging positions create advancement advantages.
high_relevance.relevance_to_rqs: Clarifies how mentorship, review interactions, and network position affect movement from periphery to core, especially when AI alters contribution patterns.
high_relevance.relevance_to_model: Affects Implicit Knowledge Transfer (Mentorship), Trust Building, PR Feedback quality, Promotion Rate; network structure conditions feedback loops of reputation and advancement.
high_relevance.phd_contribution: Model network-embedded effects of AI (e.g., auto-suggested reviewers, bot mediation) on bridging/closure and consequent promotion odds.
model_additions: Bot-Mediated Routing (Auxiliary) → Review Rate, PR Feedback

high_relevance.description: Teams develop shared awareness of who knows what, improving coordination and performance.
high_relevance.relevance_to_rqs: Explains how teams locate expertise and allocate reviews; AI code suggestions may disrupt or enhance who-knows-what maps, affecting progression.
high_relevance.relevance_to_model: Influences PR Review Delay, Review Rate, Issue Resolution Rate, and Knowledge Conversion Rate via coordination efficiency and expertise mapping.
high_relevance.phd_contribution: Show how AI tooling reshapes TMS accuracy and its downstream effect on review latency and contributor advancement.
model_additions: AI Tagging/Code Ownership Signals (Auxiliary) → TMS Update Rate

high_relevance.description: Performance improves when technology capabilities match task demands; affordances describe action possibilities shaped by the technology and social context.
high_relevance.relevance_to_rqs: Frames when AI coding tools augment novices versus create dependency; explains heterogeneity in progression paths with AI.
high_relevance.relevance_to_model: Modulates New Pr rate, Software Quality and Features, Skill up, and Rejection Rate via fit between AI assistance and task complexity.
high_relevance.phd_contribution: Identify boundary conditions where AI assistance accelerates or stalls progression and model their systemic effects.

adjacent_opportunities.description: Motivation quality depends on autonomy, competence, and relatedness.
adjacent_opportunities.why_adjacent: Focuses on motivational mechanisms rather than structural flows; vital as AI shifts perceived autonomy/competence.
adjacent_opportunities.novel_angle: Model how AI tools and mentorship satisfy/frustrate needs, altering retention and effort that drive progression.
adjacent_opportunities.phd_contribution: Link motivation states to contribution persistence and promotion, moderated by AI feedback quality.

adjacent_opportunities.description: A shared belief that the team is safe for interpersonal risk-taking.
adjacent_opportunities.why_adjacent: Targets micro-climate of reviews/discussions which indirectly affects learning and promotion.
adjacent_opportunities.novel_angle: Quantify how review tone, bot messages, and governance affect error-reporting and learning loops.
adjacent_opportunities.phd_contribution: Demonstrate causal pathways from safety to skill up and retention in AI-augmented code review.

adjacent_opportunities.description: Artifacts that enable coordination across communities without consensus.
adjacent_opportunities.why_adjacent: Issues, PR templates, and docs mediate between novices, experts, and AI agents.
adjacent_opportunities.novel_angle: Model how artifact quality/structure affects knowledge conversion and onboarding throughput.
adjacent_opportunities.phd_contribution: Show how AI-enhanced templates and CI feedback restructure boundary objects to accelerate progression.

adjacent_opportunities.description: Algorithms coordinate and control work by shaping visibility, evaluation, and workflows.
adjacent_opportunities.why_adjacent: Many OSS workflows now mediated by bots/CI, subtly governing access, evaluation, and pace.
adjacent_opportunities.novel_angle: Treat bots/CI as gatekeepers affecting review order, visibility, and reputational signals.
adjacent_opportunities.phd_contribution: Estimate how algorithmic triage changes queue dynamics and promotion fairness under AI-induced PR surges.

adjacent_opportunities.description: Technological change complements certain skills while substituting others.
adjacent_opportunities.why_adjacent: Explains heterogeneous effects of AI on novices vs. experienced contributors’ tasks.
adjacent_opportunities.novel_angle: Model task reallocation and the shifting value of review, architecture, and mentoring.
adjacent_opportunities.phd_contribution: Quantify distributional impacts of AI across roles and implications for career mobility.

adjacent_opportunities.description: Adoption spreads through social systems via perceived attributes and communication channels.
adjacent_opportunities.why_adjacent: Frames adoption of AI coding practices/tools within and across projects.
adjacent_opportunities.novel_angle: Model how AI practice diffusion changes contribution quality and reputation growth.
adjacent_opportunities.phd_contribution: Link adopter categories to review outcomes and project reputation trajectories.

cross_domain_inspiration.parallel: PRs and issues form queues with stochastic arrivals and service times (reviews, merges).
cross_domain_inspiration.transfer_potential: Predict effects of AI-driven PR influx on review delay, rejection, and burnout; test policies for triage and prioritization.
cross_domain_inspiration.rationale: Provides precise levers for throughput and latency; integrates cleanly with SD flows despite being operations-centric.

cross_domain_inspiration.parallel: Scarce maintainer/core roles create rank-order competition; prizes (status/power) drive risky effort.
cross_domain_inspiration.transfer_potential: Explain spikes in effort, gaming, or burnout as AI lowers entry barriers but not prize supply; test alternative promotion structures.
cross_domain_inspiration.rationale: Illuminates unintended consequences of meritocracy under AI—useful for designing fairer advancement mechanisms.

cross_domain_inspiration.parallel: Projects pass through stages (pioneer to climax communities) with changing niches for contributors and knowledge structures.
cross_domain_inspiration.transfer_potential: Model stage-dependent effects of AI (e.g., code generation helps pioneer growth but later requires governance/quality control).
cross_domain_inspiration.rationale: Offers a lifecycle lens to align governance, mentorship, and AI use with project maturity and contributor role availability.
